channel.title: Error
channel.description:
theres an error in the command prompt thing every time i try to log in and it sais... "exeption in thread-6 java.lang.noclassdeffounderror:cryption at client.run(client.java:16617) at java.lang.thread.run<unknown source>"
and above that there are loads of other errors saying <unknown source> or something else next to them...
can someone help me out plz?

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @allstarscape1 allstarscape1
item.description:
@allstarscape1 wrote:

then wat can i do??

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

It cannot find your cryption class.

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @allstarscape1 allstarscape1
item.description:
@allstarscape1 wrote:

Connection from 127.0.0.1:50203
Exception in thread “Thread-3” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Cryption
at client.run(client.java:16617)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Cryption
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source)
… 2 more
Disconnecting bugged player iutfifugiuiu
Exception in thread “Thread-2” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Cryption

this is the error

Read full topic

item.title: Error

item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Oh, woops. Didn’t see that it was in the client class.

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

That’s not it.
Can you copy and paste the whole exception exactly as it is (right click, click mark, highlight the text then press enter) and show us line 16617 of Client.java?

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

You probably used spaces rather than tabs in a configuration file.
